duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform complex analytical and technical staff work related to recording, analyzing, screening, and categorizing complaints, accident reports, referrals, and inquiries of unhealthful and unsafe working conditions.
Take, process, and triage notices/complaints and inquiries of alleged workplace hazards for violations of State's Safety Orders.
Audit and track complaint cases, compile statistical data, and prepare reports and correspondences for management review.
Work in accordance with DIR-DOSH policies, DOSH Compliance Policy and Procedure Manual, Directives, and Memorandums.
Provide information on the Cal/OSHA program, explaining the Cal/OSHA complaint process and employees' right to file complaints of workplace hazards to complainants and the general public.

Work in an office setting with computer, office equipment, and telephone usage. Required traveling via private, State vehicle, or public transportation (i.e. automobile, airplane, etc.) including overnight travel.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Legal Studies, Occupational Safety, or a related field (Master's preferred)
